meanings.definition: Give a false appearance of in order to conceal the truth.
meanings.sent1: She pretexted being sick to avoid going to school.
meanings.sent2: He pretexted a family emergency to leave work early.
meanings.sent3: The cat pretexted innocence after knocking over the vase.
meanings.sent4: The politician pretexted concern for the environment while ignoring pollution.
meanings.sent5: The spy pretexted friendship to gather information.

meanings.sent1: The child pretexted being a superhero during playtime.
meanings.sent2: She pretexted surprise when she already knew about the surprise party.
meanings.sent3: The dog pretexted being scared of the vacuum cleaner.
meanings.sent4: He pretexted interest in the book to impress his teacher.
meanings.sent5: The actor pretexted happiness for the camera despite feeling sad inside.
